title-group.article-title: Dynamic Properties of Single-Spool and Two-Spool Two-Stage Servovalves

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1991 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: A mathematical model of a dynamically stable flapper-nozzle pilot valve has been used in conjunction with the second stage of a flow control valve that comprises a single spool. The model has been used to calculate the valve gain and the dynamic response of the component parts. Real-time and frequency response results have been compared with those when using a two-spool version of the same type, each of the two spools being identical to the spool used in the single-spool version. It is shown that the dynamic response is improved significantly when the single-spool replaces the two-spool version.

ref.mixed-citation: "Moog Series 62 Low Cost Flow Control Servovalves," catalog produced by Moog, Inc., Industrial Division (1976).

Lin, S. J., and Akers, A. "A Nonlinear Model of a Flapper-Nozzle Valve, "Proceedings of American Control Conference, 2:1520-1525 (1989).
Lin, S. J., and Akers, A. "Modeling and Analysis of the Dynamics of a Flow Control Servovalve That Uses a Two-Spool Configuration," to be read at the ASME 1990 WAM, Paper No WA90/FP2.
